furnish.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to put furniture and other things into a house or room
furnish.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Having bought the house, they couldn’t afford to furnish it.
a room furnished with a desk and swivel chair
furnish.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Will these finds furnish more information on prehistoric man?
John was furnished with a list of local solicitors.
furnish.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Each company is required to furnish details of its market position to the Bank of England at the close of business each day.
The company entered into a hire-purchase agreement to furnish the goods.
The Andean oil pipeline furnishes about half of Ecuador’s exports.
The rules require brokers to furnish potential buyers with documents outlining the potential risks of their investment.
furnish.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to put furniture and other things into a house or room
furnish.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: the heavy expense of furnishing a home
All the hotel bedrooms are furnished with a phone and a safety deposit box.
